name: irrupt
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to enter a place suddenly or with force: The Boer armies irrupted into Cape Colony and Natal in October 1899.
biology
  specialized When birds or animals irrupt, they enter an area suddenly in large numbers: They occasionally irrupt in their thousands if continental food sources fail. They leave no room for non-breeding birds, which are displaced and forced to irrupt to unfamiliar ground.
More examplesFewer examplesIn 279 the Celts irrupted into Thrace, burnt Seuthopolis, and founded a kingdom of their own.
